intro: Eriolaena rulkensii, commonly known as the Rulkens' eriolaena, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
